medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnostic evaluation of early-onset obesity, congenital hypothyroidism, brachydactyly, multiple subcutaneous ossifications, and mild learning difficulties.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented at age 21.4 years with symptoms that began in early childhood, including congenital hypothyroidism and developmental issues. Patient 2 presented at age 20 months with early symptoms of multiple subcutaneous ossifications. Patient 1's symptoms have progressed with postnatal growth failure and other complications.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital hypothyroidism; history of bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome treated by surgery; right-sided hearing loss secondary to cholesteatoma; asthma; Horner syndrome; mild learning difficulties in siblings.
